results.title: The Birthday party
results.creator_credit: William Friedkin, Max J Rosenberg, Milton Subotsky and Palomar Pictures
results.brief_description: Screenplay written by Harold Pinter. In a shabby seaside English boarding house, a man’s inability to cope with his fears and guilt comes to the surface. At first, in typical Pinter style, the conversation is trivial and banal but deepens and erupts from the commonplace and comic into terror. Stars Robert Shaw, Patrick Magee and Dandy Nichols.

results.title: The Bicycle thieves = Ladri di biciclette
results.brief_description: An unemployed man is offered work as a bill-sticker provided he has his own bicycle. After retrieving his bicycle from the pawnbroker, it is stolen on the very first day of the job and he spends a day with his small son, desperately trying to find it. Hollywood offered to finance De Sica’s film, but he refused as he wanted to use non-actors in real settings. ‘The Bicycle thieves’ is an important film which explores the dignity of the ordinary person. It’s simplicity and underlying social criticism are part of its wide appeal.

results.title: Under the weather = A L'ombre
results.creator_credit: Tali, Pierre Heberrt, Yves Leduc and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: A delightful animation without narration about a group of happy vacationers who are lounging on a beach enjoying a lazy afternoon, but under cloudy skies things soon take a disturbing turn. This was the first animation by Tali who won the contest Cineastes Recherches du Studio d’Animation du Programme Francais de l’ONF in 1994.

results.title: Cries from the deep
results.creator_credit: Jacques Gagne, Jacques Bobet, Jacques-Yves Cousteau, Jean-Michel Cousteau, Cousteau Society and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The first of a two-part series, this film records the journey undertaken by marine explorer Jacques-Yves Cousteau, his 24-member team, and a Natianal Film Board of Canada crew. Working from the ‘Calypso’, a converted minesweeper transformed into a sophisticated oceanographic vessel, the team uses a helicopter, a diving saucer, inflatable boats and scuba diving equipment to explore the Grand Banks of Newfoundland, one of the world’s richest fishing areas. They discover shipwrecks, film icebergs, visit wildlife sanctuaries, where man is still an alien presence, and observe such endangered species as the beluga whale, humpback whale and harp seal. There is a fasscinating sequence showing ‘Calypso’ divers freeing a calf whale entrapped in a fishing net.

results.title: Ted Baryluk's grocery
results.creator_credit: John Paskievich, Mike Mirus, Michael Scott, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Ukranian-Canadian Ted Baryluk’s grocery store has been a fixture in Winnipeg’s north end for over 20 years. In this black and white photo study, Ted talks about his store, the customers who have come and gone, and the social changes his multi-cultural neighbourhood has seen. But most of all he wonders what will become of his store when he retires. He hopes his daughter Helen will take over, but she wants to move away. The film is a wistful rendering of a shopkeeper’s relationship with his daughter and a fascinating portrait of a neighbourhood and its inhabitants. (Awards: Yorkton, Chicago, Toronto)

results.title: Trainspotting
results.creator_credit: Danny Boyle, Andrew McDonald, Channel 4, Figment Films and Noel Gay Motion Picture Company
results.brief_description: Based on the cult novel by Irvine Welsh, “Trainspotting” is a black comedy which looks at a group of junkies in Edinburgh. Mark Renton, “the hero” of the film takes the viewer on a journey of discovery. Heroin is his mistress and the need to find and use it dictates the course of everyday events in his life. Renton’s friends share the same passions and needs as they lie, steal, cheat, and go “off their faces” in order to procure the next fix. As they edge towards self-destruction, the film never loses sight of their vulnerability or their very human weaknesses. At times graphically squalid and bleak, the film is undeniably hilarious, although not for the weak-stomached. A great soundtrack is featured together with excellent performances by Ewan McGregor, Ewen Bremner, Jonny Lee Miller, Kevin McKidd, Kelly Macdonald and Robert Carlyle.

results.title: The Blob
results.creator_credit: Irvin S. Yeaworth, Jack H. Harris and Valley Forge Films Studios
results.brief_description: The uncut colour version of the cult Sci-Fi film that established McQueen’s star quality. A small town becomes engulfed in terror when a meteorite crashes in a lonely field. McQueen and his girlfriend must convince the townsfolk to action but face total disbelief and ridicule towards what seems a fabrication by confused kids. A slimy alien gel begins swallowing people and growing larger. Classic scenes include a packed cinema screening a horror movie when the slimy gel seeps from the projector window causing an unforgetable exit of panic. Starring Steve McQueen, Aneta Corseaut and Earl Rowe. Co-starring Olin Howlin, Steven Chase and John Benson. Includes rare career highlights of Steve McQueen including famous film and television roles such as “Wanted: Dead or Alive”, “The Great Escape” and “The Defender” (with an early William “Star Trek” Shatner) and a very brief interview in relation to his off-screen dare-devil motor bike racing.

results.title: Once upon a time in China III
results.creator_credit: Tsui Hark, Ng See Yuen, Film Workshop and Golden Harvest
results.brief_description: The third adventure sees martial arts champion Jet Lee journey to Beijing to visit his father who runs a medicine factory. He arrives on the eve of the Lion Dance martial arts festival where rival factions are stirring up trouble. Once he enters the contest, things really heat up and non-stop action and amazing feats of strength and skill are the result. In Cantonese with English and Chinese subtitles.

results.title: Once upon a time in China II
results.creator_credit: Tsui Hark, Film Workshop and Golden Harvest
results.brief_description: Although not as bleak as the first in the series, the conflict between cultures and the rapidly changing values of the late 19th. century is the theme of this martial arts film starring asian champion Jet Lee. He clings to tradition in a China weakened by the invasion of imperialist forces while others like Sun Yat-Sen adapt to the change. There is plenty of hair-raising action and the final showdown in the Temple of the White Lotus will amaze. In Cantonese with English and Chinese subtitles.

results.title: Little Caesar
results.creator_credit: Mervyn LeRoy, Hal B. Wallis and First National Pictures
results.brief_description: ‘Little Caesar’ made Edward G.Robinson a star and exemplified the 1930’s gangster movie. Robinson plays “little tough guy” Caesar Enrico Bandello, whom with his cohort Joe Massara played by Douglas Fairbanks Jr., head for the big city in pursuit of power and wealth. His ruthlessness sees him climb to the top over his rivals, but success is short-lived in a world filled with violence and corruption. Mervyn Le Roy hired three mobsters as advisors and the film’s authenticity is a testimony to his attention to detail and fascination for the subject matter.
